Robin Williams Tribute

Robin Williams

~Hilarious, Heartwarming, Sweet, Truly-genius~

Personal Biography

Born: July 21, 1951 in Chicago, Illinois
Died: August 11, 2014 by suicide (Age 63)

Awards:

  • 5 Grammys
  • 5 Peoples Choice Awards
  • 4 Golden Globes
  • 2 Emmys
  • 1 Academy Award(Oscars)

Robin Williams, the funnyman who made not just America but the whole world laugh at his wonderful antics, was an American actor and comedian loved equally by both kids and adults for his quirky expressions, charming clumsiness, and innocent yet witty dialogues. Even though more famous as a comedian, Williams was a very talented personality who could pull off a very serious role with the same ease as he performed a comedic one.

Career

Started career as a stand-up comedian in Los Angelos. In the 1970s he was spotted by a producer and made his first television appearence in 1977. He progressed in his comedy career with more appearances on TV and eventually landed a lead role in a show "Mork & Mindy" which aired until 1982.

William's next big break in the industry was his lead role in the movie "Popeye", playing as Popeye the Sailor Man. More roles followed quickly after and soon had his first movie nomination for an award in 1984.

  • Good Will Hunting(1997)
  • Awakenings(1990)
  • Dead Poets Society(1989)
  • Good Morning, Vietnam(1987)
  • Mrs. Doubtfire(1993)

Charity Involvement

  • Comic Relief
  • Christopher and Dana Reeve Foundation
  • United Services Organizations, Inc.

He also started his own foundation called the Windfall Foundation.

If you enjoyed this page you should read more about Robin Williams at his Wiki Page.
